headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; Trial of James Stephens for the Murder of His Wife by Poison--Stephens Purchases Arsenic, and Arsenic is Found in the Body. FIFTH DAY. COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER. SUPREME COURT. The Hatch Divorce Case--Injunction Applied for Against Dr. Harch. UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT- SUPERIOR COURT

docs.lead_paragraph: Before the Hon. Judge Roosevelt. At the opening of the Court Miss Fanny Bell was recalled by the District-Attorney. She was asked whether she did not misunderstand the question put to her by Ex-Attorney-General Cushing, on Thursday, relative to the cause of her aunt's decease,--whether or not she wrote home to her father that her aunt died from intemperance.

docs.snippet: Captain Couthony telegraphs from Orleans, Massachusetts, March 9, that the brig Monagos, of Boston, from St. Thomas, Feb. 19, in ballast, went ashore on Nauset Beach, at 3 P. M., in a thich from the eastward. The crew were saved with their...
docs.lead_paragraph: Captain Couthony telegraphs from Orleans, Massachusetts, March 9, that the brig Monagos, of Boston, from St. Thomas, Feb. 19, in ballast, went ashore on Nauset Beach, at 3 P. M., in a thich from the eastward. The crew were saved with their instruments. Should the weather moderate, the spars and rigging will be saved. d.

docs.snippet: MEETING OF COAL-DEALERS.---There was a large and excited gathering of coal-dealers last evening, in Room No. 23, Cooper Institute, to protest against the passage of the ordinance to prevent frauds in the ?alo of coal. S. S. WARD, Esq., was appointed...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEETING OF COAL-DEALERS.---There was a large and excited gathering of coal-dealers last evening, in Room No. 23, Cooper Institute, to protest against the passage of the ordinance to prevent frauds in the ?alo of coal. S. S. WARD, Esq., was appointed Chairman, and GEO, C. FAREAR, Secretary.

docs.snippet: ITEMS.-A tub of butter was stolen yesterday under the eyes of a storekeeper, corner South Third and Eleventh-streets; the thief, though pursued, escaped with his booty....The house of Mr. BRUMEGER on Ninth-street and Fourth-avenue was entered by a...
docs.lead_paragraph: ITEMS.-A tub of butter was stolen yesterday under the eyes of a storekeeper, corner South Third and Eleventh-streets; the thief, though pursued, escaped with his booty....The house of Mr. BRUMEGER on Ninth-street and Fourth-avenue was entered by a burglar last night, who carried off a gold watch ....

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; COURT CALENDAR- COMMON PLEAS SUPEIOR COURT SUPREME COURT- Trial of James Stephens for the Murder of Ills Wife by Poison-Important Testimony of Miss Fanny Bell. Action against the Corporation.

docs.snippet: The Hon. Sylvester Mowry, of Arizona, arrived in this City yesterday from Washington, and has taken rooms at the New-York Hotel. Bishop Simpson has so far recovered his health as to be able to leave Pittsburgh to attend the meeting of Conference at...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hon. Sylvester Mowry, of Arizona, arrived in this City yesterday from Washington, and has taken rooms at the New-York Hotel. Bishop Simpson has so far recovered his health as to be able to leave Pittsburgh to attend the meeting of Conference at Baltimore.

docs.snippet: Mr. AMES reported for the consideration of the Senate a bill to authorize the sale of the Washington Market property, the avails to go for the benefit of the general funds of the State. Mr. ELY also introduced a bill from the Select Committee, of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. AMES reported for the consideration of the Senate a bill to authorize the sale of the Washington Market property, the avails to go for the benefit of the general funds of the State. Mr. ELY also introduced a bill from the Select Committee, of which he is Chairman, confirming the title of the property above referred to in the Commissionors of the Sinking Fund of the City.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION--CASTLE GARDEN--EMIGRATION RUNNERS.--From the weekly statement submitted at the meeting of the Board yesterday after noon, it appears that to the 9th inst. 4516 emigrants arrived at this port against 4,079 to the same date...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION--CASTLE GARDEN--EMIGRATION RUNNERS.--From the weekly statement submitted at the meeting of the Board yesterday after noon, it appears that to the 9th inst. 4516 emigrants arrived at this port against 4,079 to the same date last year.

docs.snippet: The African Coast-Guard Squadron, sustained at an annual cost of nearly one million of dollars, forced cut of the pockets of the American people by the Ashburton Treaty of 1842, have their rendezvous at this Island of St. Jago, one of the group of...

headline.main: FROM THE AFRICAN SQUADRON.; The U. S. Navy Coast-Guarders in Africa--Cruising Down the Coast--"Salt Horse" and "Hard Tack '--Turkeys and Tomatoes--Leuers from Home--Hospitality--India Ink Artists on Shipboard--Tattoo Statistics--What is Eaton on a Man-of-War, & c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The African Coast-Guard Squadron, sustained at an annual cost of nearly one million of dollars, forced cut of the pockets of the American people by the Ashburton Treaty of 1842, have their rendezvous at this Island of St. Jago, one of the group of the Cape de Verds. Three of the cruisers are now here--the flagship, the ever-moving Dale, and the Marion. The Vincennes is expected next month.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY.; Canal Debts--The Personal Liberty Bill Statistics of the Underground Railroad-- Abolition and Disunion--Progress on the Registry Law, &c., &c.
